title: Probability and Statistics with Data Analysis

vocab.definition: The likelihood that an event will occur, expressed as a number between 0 and 1
All possible outcomes of a probability experiment
Events where the outcome of one does not affect the outcome of another
A measure of how spread out data points are from the mean

teachingNotes: Use real data sets and technology. Connect to real-world decision making. Emphasize the difference between theoretical and experimental probability.

sample.question: If you flip a fair coin twice, what is the probability of getting exactly one head?
expectedAny: HT and TH are 2 out of 4 equally likely outcomes

truefalse.question: Independent events do not affect each other's outcomes.
expectedAny: by definition, independent events don't influence each other

multiplechoice.question: A data set has values: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. What is the mean?

fillintheblank.question: If P(A) = 0.3 and P(B) = 0.4, and A and B are independent, then P(A and B) = _____.

shortanswer.question: Explain why a larger sample size generally gives more accurate probability estimates.

wordProblems.question: A quality control inspector finds 3 defective items in a sample of 50. Based on this data, estimate the probability that a randomly selected item is defective.
